intro: Selliguea setacea, commonly known as the hairy liverwort, is a species of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy structure with a distinctive hairy appearance on its stems and leaves. This liverwort typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually arranged in a spiral pattern and possess a smooth or slightly textured surface. Selliguea setacea plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
